description: 共同科英文（一）課程為一學年課程，每學期兩學分，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 增進學生英語溝通表達能力
透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神
透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野
透過課堂討論培養批判精神
提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
_**O**_**bjectives:** This course is designed to support college freshmen in their use of **English language in academic context** and to improve their **reading proficiency and vocabulary knowledge** through intensive and extensive reading and reading skill/strategy training. In addition to reading and vocabulary abilities, this class also aims to build up students’ proficiency in the other **three main language skills**—**writing, listening, and speaking**—through activities that integrate the four language skills. The objectives of this class include developing students’ (1) **effective English reading skills**, (2) **improved fluency** in expressing ideas **in oral and written forms in English**, and (3) **autonomous self-study skills** using technologies such as computers and internet. In order to do so, there a four-pronged approach to the course:

**1) Firstly,** the **course textbook and online practice website** emphasize vocabulary learning and building in order to provide students the structure and tools to acquire new words. There is also a purposefully structured skills and strategies program to propel language learning and create independent learners. Furthermore, the textbook helps improve reading proficiency and develop practical critical thinking.

**2) Secondly,** over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake **one major task-based project**, in which task groups, of no more than 4 students per group, are asked to investigate areas and topics that are of interest to them, and then present their work to the class via film, audio, performance or presentation. Examples include short films (comedy, drama, horror), radio shows (news, weather, interviews, ads), plays (skits, drama, musicals), shows (music, magic, games).

**3) Thirdly,** You must visit **Self-Access Room** (Main campus 樸101) **and/or English Chat Room** (Gongguan Library A107 or Main Campus 樸102) as much as you can. You are expected to visit them for at least 10 hours in total this semester. Furthermore, students should practice their English every chance they get, e.g. **Lexile reading and autonomous learning.** **Record these experiences in your notebook for grading!**

**4) Finally**, students will be asked to do a **writing workshop** in the second half of the course, by writing up short critical essays based on class work

.

**N.B:** All elements to the course will be evaluated and assessed for the final grade. 

**Textbook:** Daise, D., Norloff, C., & Carne, P. (2011) Q: Skills for Success: Reading and Writing, 4. New York: Oxford University Press. **(Second Edition!)**

**Textbook Online Practice:** [www.iQQonlinePractice.com](http://www.iqqonlinepractice.com/)

**Materials:** A **Notebook** for taking notes on new vocabulary, phrases, grammar, task project, homework, autonomous work and critical thinking assignments.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Ten Commandments!**

**1.**    _**Punctual attendance** is essential. Talk to or email me if you can’t attend class._

**2.**    This is a **Flip Class**. Homework must be done for the class to work properly. This includes reviewing and previewing class chapters.

**3.**    Actively **participate in class discussions**.

**4.**    _**Grades will be downgraded** for failure to attend class without reason, excessive lateness, lack of participation or failure to do homework._ 

**5.**    You need to **submit homework _six times_** during the semester.

**6.**    Task assignments, homework, and paragraph essays **must be done and be on time**.

**7.**    Smartphones, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

**8.**    _**No eating** during class, but drinks are allowed._

**9.**    Y_ou must **visit Self-Access Room** (Main campus 樸101) **and/or English Chat Room** (Gongguan Library A107 or Main Campus 樸_102) as much as you can. You are expected to visit them for at least _10 hours_ in total this semester.

**10\.**  **Autonomous English Practice**: Students should practice their English every chance they get, e.g. Lexile reading. **These experiences should be recorded in your notebook for grading!**

_**Grading Policy****: The Business!**_

Final grades are based and assessed on student performances in the following:

_**1)** Attendance and Participation: 10%_

_**2)** Task Project: 20% (Presentation: 10%, drafts and reflection: 10%)_

_**3)** Midterm Quiz: 10%_

_**4)** Critical essays/movie review: 20%_

_**5)** Self-access classroom/chat room/Lexile reading/auto-learning: 20%_

_**7)** Final Exam: 20%_
